intro: Irlbachia alata subsp. alba, commonly known as the white-winged bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to southern Europe. It features showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink, with a distinctive winged structure on the petals. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are hairy and covered in fine pubescence. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. This species is often found in rocky or limestone-rich habitats.
